longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 1 month beyond the period of intended
  stay. 
 - Passports and other documents accepted for entry issued by
   Hong Kong (SAR China) must be valid on arrival. 
 - "Exit-entry Permit for Travelling to and from Hong Kong and
   Macao" (EEP); AND exit endorsement issued by Public
   Security Bureau Office in Mainland China must be valid on
   arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of Hong Kong (SAR China) Permanent Identity Card. 
- Holders of "Exit-entry Permit for Travelling to and from
  Hong Kong and Macao" (EEP).
- Residents of Macao (SAR China) holding "Macao Smart
  Permanent Identity Card  (MSPIC) or  Macao (SAR China)
  Travel Permit".
- Holders of "Visit Permit for Residents of Macao (SAR China)
  to Hong Kong (SAR China)" (VPRM).
- Holders of a PRC Travel Document (Lu Xing Zheng).
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for Holders of Hong Kong (SAR China)
passports. 
Visa required, except for Holders of "Exit-entry Permit for
Traveling to and from Hong Kong and Macao" (EEP) containing
(or accompanied by) an exit endorsement issued by Public
Security Bureau Office in Mainland China stating purpose of
entry. 
Visa required, except for Holders of a PRC Travel Document (Lu
Xing Zheng) containing an entry permit for Hong Kong (SAR
China) . 
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 180 days for holders
of a  Macao Smart Permanent Identity Card  (MSPIC) ;
accompanied by proof of Macao permanent residency. When not
holding proof of permanent residency 
. 
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 180 days for
residents of Macao (SAR China) holding a "Visit Permit for
Residents of Macao (SAR China) to Hong Kong (SAR China)" ;
accompanied by proof of Macao permanent residency. When not
holding proof of permanent residency 
. 
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 7 days for: 
 - holders of passports issued by China (People's Rep.),
   provided passenger is in transit (incl. overland) to/from a
   third country.
 - holders of a Macao (SAR China) passport or a Macao (SAR
   China) Travel Permit; 
Visa required, except for Holders of:
- travel documents issued by the Hong Kong Immigration
Department, endorsed with "Holder's eligibility for Hong Kong
(SAR China) Permanent Identity Card verified ; or
- a Hong Kong (SAR China) Permanent Identity Card. 
Visa required, except for Holders of an APEC Business Travel
Card (ABTC) provided endorsed  Valid for travel
to HKG":
 - traveling on business;
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination.
- Female nationals of Mainland China (People's Rep.) in
  advanced stages of pregnancy (28 weeks or more), suspected
  to be entering Hong Kong to give birth, must hold a booking
  confirmation certificate issued by a Hong Kong hospital,
  proving arrangements for admission.
Warning:
- Passport number and nationality must match those stated on
  the APEC Business Travel Card (ABTC).
- Visitors not holding return/onward ticket could be refused
  entry
